snippet: A gas cloud that has been hurtling toward the center of the Milky Way is expected to collide with a black hole, an exciting experience for astronomers.
abstract: Gas cloud hurtling toward center of Milky Way is expected to collide with black hole Sagittarius A in March or April 2014, providing scientists with chance to watch a black hole's devouring appetite in action; encounter should provide insight about feeding habits of black holes, ultradense collapsed objects whose extraordinary gravity acts like one-way membrane that sucks in even light.
lead_paragraph: A gas cloud that has been hurtling toward the center of the Milky Way is expected to collide with a black hole, an exciting experience for astronomers.

headline.main: It’s Snack Time in the Cosmos
headline.print_headline: It’s Snack Time in the Cosmos
